4.Pros: can get into positions for training or stocking that provide free meals in addition to your regular shifts/position as well as opening/closing shifts that pay more. Can also advance to a shift manager for a smidgen of extra money, but it's so stressful who really wants that? My advice is become a closer, that shift is usually much more relaxed and you get paid an extra $1+/hour every day of the week, not just during closing time. Benefits: full time has a few, not significant; part time all you get is half off a burger/salad and drink/dessert not off the "dollar menu and more".
4.Cons: People/managers always stressed and negative. There are some good ones, but generally people aren't very happy there. Management is essentially always under such stress to make times (yes we time orders down to the second). Also, that sort of place attracts all sorts of people that maybe you wouldn't normally want to associate with...if you know what I mean. Honestly, just find a server job at a nicer restaraunt near you. Better environment, more opportunities, benefits, and frankly you'll make Much more with tips than your salary here.
